name: Moving Riddles? Quiz | Brain Teasers | 5 Questions

questions.text:
Floating on water, without a care.

Float over land, on a cushion of air.

What form of transport am I?
questions.explanation:
Hovercraft & A Hovercraft.

	Christopher Cockerell developed the hovercraft in the 1950s.

questions.text:
We sound like flatfish, but have no doubt.

On frozen water, we're assets to get you about.
questions.explanation:
Skates.

	The first part of the riddle alludes to the flatfish skate.

questions.text:
I am famous in China, but was infamous in Berlin.

Now - add a male monarch, the exercise can begin.
questions.explanation:
Walking.

	The first line hints at the Great Wall of China and the Berlin Wall.The male monarch is a king. Wall + king = walking.

questions.text:
Two revolutions are all you need.

You might have called me a velocipede.

I'll get you around at moderate speed.
questions.explanation:
Bicycle.

	Bi is the prefix for two. One complete revolution is a cycle. Bi + cycle = bicycle.

questions.text:
Treads and risers, up or down I travel.

Continuously moving, you're on another level.
questions.explanation:
Escalator.

	Stairs have treads and risers. The moving stairs that take you from one level of a building to another is an escalator.
